page.title: 09Loughton Then and Now
page.content: We interviewed people about the {changes}that have happened in Loughton and they thought that old Loughton was better because there was more choice of shops and personal attention. Groceries were cheaper and of better quality. Many of the older{shops}which people prefered have gone and in their place is the modern supermarket. This was one of the main reasons for the formation of the{LRA}(Loughton Residents Association), to protest against this. The LRA is the non- political branch of local government with six representatives and also one on the County Council. Loughton was a small quiet village with little{traffic}but now there is heavy congestion with cars and other vehicles and this makes parking and shopping difficult.
